text: Hi, thanks, im looking to show a map and interact with it (autocomplete address field ), and save coordinates in HubSpot

So in the design manager when editing modules next to the fields button on the right you can copy all the json which i thought to be handy when using the same fields somewhere else. But when i create a new module i cannot past that json or don't know where to past it anywhere to create or duplicate the fields. Or is that json not intented for this purpose, or do i need to put it anywhere else... in the fields.json??

My suggestion would be then:

If you want the map to show and interact based on an address field, 1. you'll want to create the address field CRM properties either contact or company 2. <https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/geocoding/overview|Code a function to output coordinates relative to the address> of the CRM 3. Output and save the coordinates to a map thru the method above on either a page or any other content type in your HS portal.

Copying the whole JSON, through that button, copies all the json fields related to the module. To implement this effectively into a different module for the same field structure, it is recommended to use <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/getting-started-with-modules|Local Development> to dupe/create these fields for a new module (pull down the raw JSON, place it on the custom modules fields.json file); simply paste what you copied into the new module's fields.json file. then once created locally, you can upload to your portal with the fields and adjust the html, css, js
Thx Collin, that makes somewhat sense, likewise if you could just past the json the same way when creating a new module
yea its tough to do this in Design Tools because the custom module editor in there does not have a fields.json editor
in the desing view i mean ofcourse

doing this in local dev, you get 4 files

1. html/hubl
2. css
3. js
4. fields.json
youd just paste all that in #4
in the design view, we have no access to the raw fields.json of the module, instead, we have that right-hand sidebar GUI
exactly thank you very much, i forgot aboyt that extra fields.json per module in local dev
We do have acces in the qui because we are able to copy it already...
so why not paste it as well

good feedback. not sure the explicit reason why the raw json isn't available in design tools, or that there is no toggle between the GUI and fields.json code. presumably, it has something to do with ideal "developer flow" and how most devs prefer to developer. can let you know a full answer tho if youd like me to ask the product team

you can still copy/paste each individual hubl field to use inside the template itself, by copying snippet/value of each field. it's just the mapping/json structure itself that cannot be done in the design tools with raw code, just through the gui
No for now it's clear i was just wondering if i missed something and initially what you said helped me out setting up module fields faster than recreating them through the GUI

On this page I have a button in the right column that is spanning the entire column wide. I dont want it to be 100% but when I change it to 30% it is no longer centered. I am looking for the css that I need to add to the module. Any help would be appreciated. <https://info.kellerheartt.com/style-guide>
Ahhh, yes. Thanks! You are always so helpful Andreas! Have a fantastic day!
